subject: Nutrition
title: The Paradox of Choice
description: A 60-second lesson on The Paradox of Choice.

hook.text: A grocery store offers 40,000 products. More choice should help, but it makes healthy eating harder.

buildup.text: Too many options cause decision fatigue. The brain defaults to familiar comfort foods when overwhelmed.

discovery.text: The jam study proved itâ€”shoppers shown 24 varieties bought less than those shown only 6.

twist.text: Meal delivery services succeed partly by reducing choice. Fewer options mean faster, better decisions.

climax.text: Simplifying your food environmentâ€”fewer visible snacks, fewer meal optionsâ€”leads to healthier eating.

punchline.text: Less choice often leads to better decisions.
